page.title: 18The Blacksmith of Ardleigh.
page.content: { JIM SMITH started}in the {wooden {smithy}in{Ardleigh}in{1951 { His forge}was heated up by a hand-pumped bellows.He repaired harrows and ploughs,put iron tyres on wooden wagon and shod farm horses and hunters.The village children loved to watch Jim and the horses. { Now in his modern workshop}Jim's machinery includes a small generator,metal-cutting circular saw and guillotine,band saw,portable arc welder, power hammer, grinders and a forge anvil. He has large stocks of steel bars, plates,nuts and bolts. Jim has 3 men,working 9-1O hour a day and another man going out daily to emergencies in the mobile welding unit. { They repair large farm and builders {machinery}and do{scroll work for gates and{grates}and even a {20ft.bird cage.
